member.name: M:Microsoft.MetadirectoryServices.ManagementAgent.EscapeDNComponent(System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a object that contains an escaped distinguished name component from an array of strings. The strings should not contain escaped characters.
member.param: Contains an array of strings that will be used to build the distinguished name component.
member.exception: Thrown when the the management agent requires a distinguished name with a single component and the parts parameter contains zero components or more than one component.
Thrown when a memory allocation failure occurs.

member.summary: Creates a object that contains an escaped distinguished name component from an array of objects.
member.param: Contains an array of objects that that will be used to build the distinguished name component.
member.exception: Thrown when the the management agent requires a distinguished name with a single component and the parts parameter contains zero components or more than one component.
Thrown when a memory allocation failure occurs.
member.returns: Returns a object that represents the escaped distinguished name component.

member.name: M:Microsoft.MetadirectoryServices.ManagementAgent.UnescapeDNComponent(System.String)
member.summary: Extracts the individual naming elements from a distinguished name component. The component can contain escaped characters.
member.param: Contains the distinguished name component from which the elements will be extracted.
member.exception: Thrown when the distinguished name component that is represented by the component parameter is not properly escaped or cannot be parsed.
member.returns: Returns an array of strings that contains the individual naming elements of the distinguished name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.MetadirectoryServices.ManagementAgent.NormalizeString(System.String)
member.summary: If the management agent is configured to normalize string values during direct export attribute flow mappings then this method will perform those same string normalization operations on the specified string. If the management agent is not configured to normalize string values then this method will simply return the specified string unchanged.
member.returns: The normalized form of the string.

member.summary: An add is exported to the connected data source, but the object is already present in the connected data source.

members.member: The anchor on the object is not unique.
An update or delete cannot be applied because the anthor is not unique.
The password attribute is set to a value that does not meet the administrator-define password policy of the connected data source.
The password attribute is being set or changed and the FIM server machine time is more than five minutes different from the time on the domain controller.
The management agent tries to set or change a password attribute and cannot resolve the server for the domain part of the logon credentials.
The distinguished name is incompatible with the connected data source naming requirements.
The export of an add, modify, or delete violates connected data source enforced constraints.
The value for an attribute violates certain value constraints.
A naming attribute (such as CN for many object types) is set to a value that conflicts with the relative distinguished name (also known as RDN) value
The management agent has insufficient permissions to perform the operation against the connected data source.
Certain attributes that are required for provisioning a new object have not been set.
Certain attributes for provisioning are invalid.
A value required for constructing the anchor is not available.
One of the attributes that are used in constructing the anchor has multiple values.
The anchor construction produces an anchor that exceeds the maximum size limit for FIM.
An attribute value that contains characters which are invalid for the connected data source.
